page.title: 15Religion in the Maylands
page.content: The most populated part has a{family {centre}administered by the mother church, St. Barnabas (out of this block) used for{Anglican services, taken by the vicar; also for{R.C. services for which a priest comes from Burnham, 6 miles away. The centre is used for other community activities and there is a{weekly service}for mothers and children which is well attended, but this is seen as a short term measure, as far as church attendance is concerned. Others may use Christchurch in Latchingdon, where there is a{non conformist chapel. There is a vicar resident in Maylandsea. The Anglican congregations are not large and the free evangelical type of worship has an increasing following.
